DISCORD.name: Discord
DISCORD.tagline: Creating space for communities to gather, connect, and communicate through voice, video, and text
DISCORD.overview: Discord is a communication platform founded in 2015 by Jason Citron and Stanislav Vishnevsky. Originally designed for gamers, Discord has expanded to serve communities across education, crypto, music, and more. The platform reaches over 200 million monthly users across 60,000+ game titles (1.5B hours of gameplay monthly). Discord raised $600M at $15B valuation in 2021 and generated $879M revenue in 2024. Microsoft attempted to acquire Discord for $12B in 2021 but the deal fell through. The company began testing ads in 2024 as it expands beyond gaming.

DANA.name: DANA
DANA.tagline: Indonesian digital wallet empowering financial inclusion through seamless payments and digital financial services
DANA.overview: DANA (Dompet Anak Negeri) is Indonesia's leading digital wallet platform, serving over 200 million users nationwide. Founded in 2017 and launched in 2018 by former Alipay Indonesia executive Vincent Henry Iswaratioso, DANA enables QRIS payments, peer-to-peer transfers, and online/offline purchases. Backed by Ant Group (Alibaba), Sinar Mas Group, and Lazada Group, the company achieved unicorn status with a valuation of $1.2 billion. DANA processes an average of 10 million daily transactions and has become a pillar of Indonesia's digital economy, ranking as the country's second most valuable fintech startup.

DAPPER-LABS.name: Dapper Labs
DAPPER-LABS.tagline: Building consumer blockchain products for digital collectibles, gaming, and Web3 entertainment experiences
DAPPER-LABS.overview: Dapper Labs is a Canadian blockchain company that created CryptoKitties, the first viral NFT project, and NBA Top Shot, one of the most successful mainstream blockchain applications. Founded in 2018 by Roham Gharegozlou, the company developed the Flow blockchain specifically designed for consumer applications and digital collectibles. NBA Top Shot, developed with the NBA, has generated $1.2 billion in total sales with 1.6 million users. Notable investors include Michael Jordan, Kevin Durant, a16z, Coatue, and Google Ventures. The company has partnered with major entertainment brands including the NFL, UFC, and Disney Pinnacle.

DARWINBOX.name: Darwinbox
DARWINBOX.tagline: Cloud-based HR management platform transforming employee engagement across the organizational lifecycle
DARWINBOX.overview: Darwinbox is a leading cloud-based Human Resources Management Software (HRMS) company that became India's first HR tech unicorn in 2022. Founded in 2015 by Chaitanya Peddi, Jayant Paleti, and Rohit Chennamaneni in Hyderabad, the platform engages employees throughout their organizational lifecycle from hire to retire. Darwinbox serves 900+ global enterprises managing over 2 million employees, with customers including Adani, Mahindra, Starbucks, Kotak, and Tokopedia. The company has raised over $255 million, including $140 million in 2025 led by Partners Group and KKR, positioning it for global expansion and enhanced AI-powered HR solutions.

DATABRICKS.name: Databricks
DATABRICKS.tagline: Data and AI company powering analytics and AI applications with unified data lakehouse platform
DATABRICKS.overview: Databricks is a leading data and AI company founded in 2013 by the creators of Apache Spark. The company provides a unified Data Intelligence Platform that enables organizations to democratize access to data and AI, making it easier to harness the power of their data for analytics and AI applications. As of November 2025, Databricks is in talks to raise funding at a valuation exceeding $130 billion, representing a 30% increase from its September 2025 Series K round at $100 billion. With over 15,000 customers including 60% of the Fortune 500, Databricks has become the cornerstone of enterprise data and AI infrastructure, generating over $4 billion in annual revenue run-rate with 50% year-over-year growth and positive free cash flow.

DEALHUB.name: DealHub
DEALHUB.tagline: AI-powered Quote-to-Revenue platform unifying CPQ, subscriptions, billing, and revenue recognition for modern sales teams
DEALHUB.overview: DealHub is a comprehensive Quote-to-Revenue platform that unifies CPQ (Configure-Price-Quote), contract management, subscription billing, consumption metering, and automated revenue recognition. Founded in 2014, the company uses AI to streamline the entire revenue lifecycle from quote to cash. Following its acquisition of Subskribe, DealHub addresses the full complexity of modern monetization for B2B companies. Named Frost & Sullivan's 2024 North America Company of the Year for CPQ innovation, DealHub achieved $61.6 million in revenue in 2024, up from $39.9 million in 2023.

DEALSHARE.name: DealShare
DEALSHARE.tagline: Social commerce platform delivering affordable essentials to mass consumers through community-driven buying in tier 2 and 3 cities
DEALSHARE.overview: DealShare is India's second social commerce unicorn after Meesho, offering an online platform for multi-category consumer products using community-driven buying to provide affordable essentials to mass consumers in tier 2 and 3 cities. Founded in 2018 by Vineet Rao, Rajat Shikhar, Sankar Bora, and Sourjyendu Medda, the company achieved unicorn status in January 2022 with $165 million funding led by Tiger Global. The company raised a total of $387 million at a peak valuation of $1.7 billion. FY24 saw significant restructuring with revenue declining 74% to ₹499 crore while losses shrank 66% as the company pivots its model.

DEBANK.name: DeBank
DEBANK.tagline: Web3-native portfolio tracker and messenger covering DeFi positions, tokens, and NFTs across all EVM chains
DEBANK.overview: DeBank is a leading Web3-native portfolio tracker and messenger that enables users to monitor their entire DeFi portfolio across tokens, staking positions, liquidity pools, yield farming, and NFTs in one centralized dashboard. Founded in 2018 by Tang Hongbo, DeBank supports over 35 blockchains and 1,300+ DeFi protocols including Ethereum, BSC, and Avalanche. Beyond portfolio tracking, DeBank has evolved into a Web3 social platform with whale wallet tracking, social rankings, and Web3 User ID features. Over 300 projects utilize DeBank's data infrastructure through their API services.

DECAGON.name: Decagon
DECAGON.tagline: AI-powered customer support platform delivering human-like interactions and autonomous agent capabilities for enterprise
DECAGON.overview: Decagon is a generative AI company powering enterprise customer support with human-like AI agents. Founded by Jesse Zhang (CEO) and Ashwin Sreenivas (CTO), the company emerged from stealth in June 2024 and rapidly achieved unicorn status in 2025 with a $1.5 billion valuation. Decagon's AI agents autonomously manage customer interactions from start to finish, including fetching data, taking actions, and reviewing conversations. Industry leaders including Duolingo, Notion, Rippling, Eventbrite, and Bilt use Decagon to transform their customer experience operations.

DECART.name: Decart
DECART.tagline: AI world simulator creating real-time interactive worlds and games through next-frame prediction without traditional game engines
DECART.overview: Decart is an Israeli AI company building real-time generative AI world simulators that can create playable interactive environments without traditional game engines. The company emerged from stealth in October 2024 with Oasis, the first playable real-time AI open-world model that replicates Minecraft gameplay through next-frame prediction, trained on millions of hours of footage. Unlike OpenAI's Sora which takes 10-20 seconds per second of video, Decart generates 20 frames per second with zero latency. Founded by Robert Wachen (Harvard) and Dean Leitersdorf (Technion), the company reached 1 million users in just 3 days and has raised $53 million from Sequoia Capital and Benchmark.

DEEL.name: Deel
DEEL.tagline: All-in-one global HR and payroll platform simplifying international workforce management and compliance
DEEL.overview: Deel is an all-in-one global HR and payroll platform founded in 2019 by Alex Bouaziz, Shuo Wang, and Ofer Simon. The company revolutionizes how businesses hire, manage, and pay international teams by providing comprehensive solutions for contractor management, employer of record services, global payroll, and HR management across 150+ countries. As of October 2025, Deel has achieved a valuation of $17.3 billion following a $300 million Series E funding round, making it one of the fastest-growing HR tech companies globally. With over $1 billion in annual recurring revenue and serving 37,000+ businesses including Shopify, Nike, Reddit, and Cloudflare, Deel processes $22 billion in payroll annually for 1.5 million workers worldwide. The company owns and operates 150+ local entities globally, providing native payroll infrastructure rather than relying on third-party partners.

DEGREED.tagline: Upskilling platform connecting learning to career opportunities for workforce development at scale
DEGREED.overview: Degreed is an upskilling platform that connects learning to career opportunities, helping companies retain and reskill employees while supporting their career development. Founded in 2012 by David Blake with the mission of 'jailbreaking the degree,' the platform is now used by one-third of Fortune 500 companies. Degreed achieved unicorn status in April 2021 with a $153 million Series D led by Sapphire Ventures and Riverwood Capital at a $1.4 billion valuation. The company leverages AI technologies to bridge development gaps in team skills, focusing on targeted improvements and measurable outcomes.

DELIVERECT.name: Deliverect
DELIVERECT.tagline: SaaS platform integrating online food delivery orders into restaurant POS systems for streamlined operations
DELIVERECT.overview: Deliverect is a Belgian FoodTech unicorn providing a SaaS platform that integrates online orders from food delivery channels into restaurant POS systems. Founded in 2018 by Zhong Xu, Jan Hollez, Jelte Vrijhoef, and Jérôme Laredo, the platform connects restaurants with Uber Eats, DoorDash, Grubhub, Deliveroo, and more, automating order flow directly to the kitchen. Deliverect now powers over 55,000 restaurants across 52 countries, processing 450 million orders annually and targeting 800 million in 2025. The company achieved unicorn status in 2022 with $150 million Series D funding at $1.4 billion valuation, and revenue reached $44.7 million in 2024.

DENSITY.name: Density
DENSITY.tagline: AI-powered workplace analytics platform using sensors to measure space utilization and occupancy
DENSITY.overview: Density is a workplace analytics unicorn providing AI-powered sensors and software that measure how people use physical spaces. The company's anonymous people-counting technology helps enterprises optimize real estate portfolios, improve office layouts, and make data-driven workplace decisions. Density serves Fortune 500 companies including Cisco, Uber, and LinkedIn with its depth sensor technology that counts occupancy without collecting personal data. The platform integrates with workplace management tools to provide real-time occupancy data and historical trends for space planning.

DENTAL-MONITORING.name: DentalMonitoring
DENTAL-MONITORING.tagline: AI-powered remote monitoring platform enabling orthodontists to track patient treatment through smartphone scans
DENTAL-MONITORING.overview: DentalMonitoring is a French HealthTech unicorn pioneering AI-powered remote monitoring for orthodontic treatment. The platform uses deep learning algorithms to analyze patient selfies taken through a smartphone app, enabling orthodontists to monitor treatment progress without in-person visits. DentalMonitoring's proprietary AI has analyzed over 100 million dental images and achieved the first FDA De Novo approval for AI-powered orthodontic monitoring as a Software as a Medical Device (SaMD). The company serves thousands of orthodontic practices worldwide and partners with leading aligner brands.

DEPUTY.overview: Deputy is an Australian workforce management unicorn providing scheduling, time and attendance, and communication tools for hourly and shift-based workers. Deputy serves over 365,000 workplaces globally across industries including retail, hospitality, healthcare, and manufacturing. DESTINUS.name: Destinus
DESTINUS.tagline: Building hydrogen-powered hypersonic aircraft for intercontinental cargo and defense applications
DESTINUS.overview: Destinus is a European aerospace and defense company developing hydrogen-powered hypersonic aircraft capable of traveling at speeds exceeding Mach 5. Founded by serial aerospace entrepreneur Mikhail Kokorich, the company aims to revolutionize long-haul logistics and transportation with aircraft twice as fast as the Concorde while producing zero carbon emissions. Destinus has achieved Mach 1.3 with its Destinus-3 prototype and supplies hydrogen-powered drones for military applications. The company's dual-use technology addresses both civilian cargo transport and defense markets, with customers including the Ukrainian military.

DEVO.overview: Devo is a cybersecurity unicorn providing a cloud-native security data platform that enables enterprises to perform real-time threat detection, investigation, and response at massive scale. The company's logging and security analytics solution ingests and analyzes petabytes of security data in real-time, helping security operations centers (SOCs) detect threats faster than traditional SIEM solutions. Devo serves Fortune 500 enterprises and government agencies with its elastic, scalable architecture that eliminates data silos and provides sub-second query performance across years of historical data. DEVREV.overview: DevRev is an AI unicorn building an AI-native platform that unifies customer relationship management with product development. Founded by Dheeraj Pandey and Manoj Agarwal, former Nutanix executives, DevRev leverages large language models and autonomous AI agents to connect customer conversations directly to product engineering workflows. The AgentOS platform enables enterprises to deploy AI agents that handle customer support, automate ticketing, and provide developers with contextual customer insights. DevRev aims to replace legacy CRM systems like Zendesk and Salesforce with an AI-first approach to customer-centricity.

The company's proprietary AI gives robots human-like dexterity to perform complex manipulation tasks including picking, packing, palletizing, and truck trailer loading. Dexterity serves global logistics leaders including FedEx, UPS, and GXO with robots that free workers from repetitive and strenuous tasks. DFINITY.name: DFINITY Foundation
DFINITY.tagline: Non-profit foundation developing the Internet Computer Protocol for decentralized cloud computing
DFINITY.overview: DFINITY Foundation is a Swiss non-profit developing the Internet Computer Protocol (ICP), a blockchain that extends the functionality of the public internet to host smart contracts, web applications, and data at scale. Founded by computer scientist Dominic Williams, the project aims to create a 'World Computer' that allows developers to build and run web applications entirely on blockchain without traditional cloud providers. The ICP network features 500% year-on-year growth in on-chain compute, AI capabilities for smart contracts, and cross-chain interoperability with Bitcoin and Ethereum. The ecosystem has distributed over $6M in grants to 239 projects across 41 countries.

Dialpad's AI-native architecture turns every conversation into actionable insights, helping over 70,000 businesses make smarter decisions. The platform serves enterprises including Netflix, Uber, and WeWork with cloud-native communications that work from anywhere.

DIAMOND-FOUNDRY.name: Diamond Foundry
DIAMOND-FOUNDRY.tagline: Zero-emission lab-grown diamond producer using plasma reactors for jewelry and semiconductor applications
DIAMOND-FOUNDRY.overview: Diamond Foundry is a clean tech unicorn producing lab-grown diamonds using zero-emission plasma reactors powered by renewable energy. The company grows single-crystal diamonds for jewelry and semiconductor applications, offering an ethical and sustainable alternative to mined diamonds. Diamond Foundry's technology creates gem-quality diamonds atom by atom in specialized reactors, with each diamond certified carbon neutral. Backed by Leonardo DiCaprio, Twitter founder Evan Williams, and iPod creator Tony Fadell, the company is expanding production in Spain with an $85M EU grant to reach 20 million carats annually.

DIANRONG.name: Dianrong
DIANRONG.tagline: China's leading online marketplace lending platform connecting borrowers with investors through technology
DIANRONG.overview: Dianrong is a Chinese fintech unicorn operating one of China's largest online marketplace lending platforms. Co-founded by Soul Htite (Lending Club co-founder) and Kevin Guo, the company uses proprietary technology to match borrowers with investors, providing access to credit for individuals and SMEs across China. Dianrong's platform leverages big data and AI for credit scoring, risk assessment, and loan origination. The company previously operated over 90 offline service centers and served millions of users, though regulatory changes in China's P2P sector led to significant restructuring in 2018-2019.

DIDI-FREIGHT.overview: DiDi Freight is a Chinese logistics unicorn and the trucking division of DiDi Chuxing, the country's largest ride-hailing company. The platform uses technology to match shippers with truck drivers for on-demand freight transportation, similar to Uber Freight. DiDi Freight competes with Full Truck Alliance (Manbang) in China's massive trucking market, leveraging DiDi's expertise in transportation technology, logistics optimization, and driver management. The company raised $1.5B in its debut funding round at a $3B valuation, backed by Temasek, Yunfeng Capital, and other major investors.

DIDI-WOYA.tagline: Pioneering autonomous vehicle technology for the future of ridesharing and transportation
DIDI-WOYA.overview: DiDi Autonomous Driving (DiDi Woya) is the self-driving technology division of DiDi Chuxing, China's largest ride-hailing platform. The company develops Level 4 autonomous driving systems for robotaxi services, combining hardware, software, and operational capabilities. DiDi's autonomous driving unit has been testing robotaxis in Shanghai and other Chinese cities, leveraging the vast driving data collected from DiDi's ride-hailing network to train and improve its autonomous systems. The division represents DiDi's bet on the future of mobility, aiming to deploy safe, efficient, and affordable autonomous ride-hailing services at scale. In November 2023, Guangzhou Automobile Group (GAC) led a strategic Series C investment in the autonomous driving unit.

DIGITAL-CURRENCY-GROUP.name: Digital Currency Group
DIGITAL-CURRENCY-GROUP.tagline: Building the foundation for a better financial system through blockchain and digital currency investments
DIGITAL-CURRENCY-GROUP.overview: Digital Currency Group (DCG) is a global enterprise that builds, buys, and invests in blockchain and digital currency companies. Founded by Barry Silbert in 2015, DCG has become one of the most influential investment firms in the cryptocurrency industry. The company owns major subsidiaries including Grayscale Investments (the world's largest digital currency asset manager), Genesis (crypto lending and trading), Foundry (Bitcoin mining and staking), and Luno (emerging markets crypto exchange). DCG has invested in over 200 blockchain-related companies including Coinbase, Ripple, Circle, Chainalysis, and many others. The firm reached a $10 billion valuation in 2021 before facing challenges from the crypto winter and Genesis bankruptcy in 2023. Founder Barry Silbert owns nearly 40% of the company.

DISPATCHHEALTH.name: DispatchHealth
DISPATCHHEALTH.tagline: Bringing high-acuity medical care to patients in the comfort of their homes
DISPATCHHEALTH.overview: DispatchHealth is a Denver-based healthcare unicorn that delivers high-acuity medical care directly to patients in their homes. Founded in 2013 by Dr. Mark Prather and Kevin Riddleberger, the company has built the largest system of in-home medical care in the United States. DispatchHealth's model bridges the gap between traditional urgent care and emergency rooms by sending fully equipped medical teams to patients' homes within hours of a request. The company's technology-enabled platform coordinates care across its network, handling everything from urgent care visits to complex hospital-level care at home. With over $907 million in funding, DispatchHealth partners with major health systems and payers including Humana, Blue Shield, and Optum to reduce emergency room utilization while improving patient outcomes and experience.

DISTROKID.name: DistroKid
DISTROKID.tagline: The easiest way for musicians to get their music into online stores and streaming services worldwide
DISTROKID.overview: DistroKid is a music distribution unicorn that enables independent musicians to upload and distribute their music to major streaming platforms like Spotify, Apple Music, Amazon Music, and TikTok. Founded in 2013 by Philip Kaplan (creator of FuckedCompany.com), the San Francisco-based company has revolutionized music distribution with its simple, affordable pricing model that lets artists keep 100% of their royalties. DistroKid reached a $1.3 billion valuation in 2021 and has grown to over 2 million artists with nearly $100 million in annual revenue by 2024. The platform processes over 3 million uploads per month and has paid out billions in royalties to independent artists. Unlike traditional distributors that charge per release, DistroKid charges a flat annual fee, making it the go-to platform for emerging musicians.

DISTYL-AI.overview: Distyl AI is a San Francisco-based enterprise AI unicorn founded in 2022 by former Palantir executives Arjun Prakash and Derek Ho. Distyl works with industry leaders in healthcare, telecommunications, insurance, manufacturing, and financial services, reaching over 120 million end users. DIVERGENT.name: Divergent Technologies
DIVERGENT.tagline: Revolutionary 3D printing and automated assembly platform transforming automotive and aerospace manufacturing
DIVERGENT.overview: Divergent Technologies is a Los Angeles-based unicorn that has developed the world's first end-to-end software-hardware production system for industrial digital manufacturing. The Divergent Adaptive Production System (DAPS) integrates AI-driven generative design software, novel materials, 3D printing, and automated fixtureless assembly to create complex structures for automotive, aerospace, and defense applications. Founded by Kevin Czinger, the company has raised over $816 million and works with luxury automakers including Aston Martin, Bugatti, and McLaren, as well as defense contractors like Lockheed Martin and Raytheon. The Czinger 21C hypercar, which features over 350 additively manufactured components, showcases the platform's revolutionary capabilities. With over 500 patent filings, Divergent is fundamentally transforming how vehicles and aerospace structures are designed and built.

DJI.overview: DJI (SZ DJI Technology Co., Ltd.) is the world's largest manufacturer of commercial drones, commanding over 90% of the global consumer drone market. Founded in 2006 by Frank Wang (Wang Tao) in Shenzhen, China, DJI has revolutionized aerial photography and videography, making drones accessible to consumers, professionals, and enterprises worldwide. DOCK.name: Dock

DOCK.overview: Dock is a decentralized identity platform that enables organizations to issue, manage, and verify digital credentials using blockchain technology. Founded in 2017 by Nick Lambert and Elina Cadouri, Dock has built a comprehensive ecosystem for reusable digital identities that are portable, private, and verifiable. The platform launched its mainnet in September 2020 with a fixed supply of 1 billion DOCK tokens. The company's solutions help organizations reduce fraud, streamline verification processes, and give individuals control over their personal data.

DOCKER.name: Docker
DOCKER.tagline: Accelerating how developers build, share, and run modern applications through containerization
DOCKER.overview: Docker is the pioneering containerization platform that revolutionized how developers build, share, and run applications. Founded in 2013, Docker created the industry-standard container format that spawned the entire cloud-native ecosystem. With over 20 million developers and 14 billion image downloads, Docker Hub is the world's largest container registry. The company achieved a $2.1 billion valuation after focusing on developer tools following the 2019 sale of its enterprise business to Mirantis. Docker Desktop provides a seamless development experience on Windows and Mac, while Docker Hub enables teams to share and collaborate on containerized applications. In 2024, Don Johnson (former Oracle Cloud Infrastructure founder) became CEO, succeeding Scott Johnston, positioning the company for continued growth and potential acquisition interest.

products.description: Industry-leading container development environment for Mac, Windows, and Linux developers

products.description: World's largest container image registry with over 14 billion pulls and millions of images

products.description: Cloud-based build acceleration service for faster container image creation

DOCPLANNER.name: DocPlanner
DOCPLANNER.tagline: Making the healthcare experience more human with online booking and practice management
DOCPLANNER.overview: DocPlanner is Europe's largest healthcare booking marketplace, connecting patients with healthcare professionals across 13 countries in Europe and Latin America. Founded in Warsaw, Poland by Mariusz Gralewski, Lucjan Samulowski, and Luca Puccioni, the company has built a network of nearly 2 million healthcare professionals serving over 260,000 customers globally. DocPlanner processes more than 22 million patient appointments monthly through its marketplace brands including ZnanyLekarz (Poland), Doctoralia (Spain, Brazil, Mexico), and Jameda (Germany). The platform also provides practice management software for doctors and clinics. DocPlanner achieved unicorn status with a $1 billion valuation in 2021 after raising €80 million in Series E funding led by One Peak Partners and Goldman Sachs.

DOCTOLIB.name: Doctolib
DOCTOLIB.tagline: Transforming healthcare in Europe through seamless online booking and practice management
DOCTOLIB.overview: Doctolib is France's most valuable startup and Europe's leading healthcare booking platform, valued at €5.8 billion. Founded in 2013 by Stanislas Niox-Chateau and co-founders, Doctolib has become a key component of France's healthcare system, serving 80 million patient accounts and 400,000 healthcare professionals across France, Germany, Italy, and the Netherlands. The company achieved €348 million in annual recurring revenue in 2024, representing 22.5% growth. Doctolib's platform combines appointment booking, telemedicine, practice management software, and AI-powered tools for healthcare providers. France accounts for 80% of revenue, with the company investing €115 million annually in R&D, particularly in AI-powered assistants for doctors. Doctolib is consistently cited as a top candidate for French tech IPO.

DOMESTIKA.name: Domestika
DOMESTIKA.tagline: The largest creative community where experts share knowledge through professionally produced online courses
DOMESTIKA.overview: Domestika is the world's largest creative community and online learning platform for creative professionals, valued at $1.3 billion. Originally founded in Madrid in 2002 and now headquartered in Berkeley, California, Domestika offers professionally-produced courses taught by top creative experts in fields including illustration, design, photography, crafts, and more. The platform distinguishes itself through high production values, affordable pricing, and a strong community of creators. Domestika achieved unicorn status in January 2022 after raising $110 million in Series D funding led by Zeev Ventures. The platform serves millions of students globally with courses available in multiple languages. The company expanded through the acquisition of CGMA, an art and design education platform, in 2022.

DOMINO-DATA-LAB.name: Domino Data Lab
DOMINO-DATA-LAB.tagline: The leading enterprise MLOps platform that accelerates data science work while enabling collaboration, reproducibility, and governance at scale
DOMINO-DATA-LAB.overview: Domino Data Lab is the leading enterprise MLOps platform that enables data science teams to develop, deploy, and monitor machine learning models at scale. Founded in 2013 by Nick Elprin and Matthew Granade, Domino provides a unified platform that accelerates research, improves collaboration, and ensures governance. Over 20% of Fortune 100 companies use Domino to build and operationalize AI models. The platform integrates with all major frameworks, tools, and infrastructure, enabling organizations to standardize and scale their data science operations while maintaining reproducibility and compliance.

DOTC-UNITED-GROUP.tagline: Creating world-class mobile platform products that connect global users through innovative utility applications and programmatic advertising technology
DOTC-UNITED-GROUP.overview: DotC United Group is a Shanghai-based technology company specializing in global mobile application development and programmatic advertising. Founded in 2015 by Chinese-German entrepreneur Yi Shi (previously founded Avazu Inc.), the company creates utility applications including WiFi sharing platforms, customizable keyboards, and security tools distributed worldwide. The company's name was inspired by Steve Jobs' commencement speech about 'connecting the dots.' By 2017, DotC United achieved unicorn status with a $1.4B+ valuation. Key products include Swift WiFi (global WiFi sharing platform) and Flash Keyboard (customizable Android keyboard), both featured on Google's global recommendation lists.

DRAGOS.name: Dragos
DRAGOS.tagline: The global leader in cybersecurity for industrial control systems and operational technology environments protecting critical infrastructure
DRAGOS.overview: Dragos is the global leader in cybersecurity for industrial control systems (ICS) and operational technology (OT) environments. Founded in 2016 by Robert M. Lee, a former NSA and U.S. Cyber Command analyst, Dragos provides purpose-built security solutions that protect critical infrastructure including electric utilities, oil and gas, manufacturing, and water systems. The company's platform combines advanced threat detection, asset visibility, and vulnerability management specifically designed for OT networks. Dragos also operates the industry's largest team of ICS/OT threat hunters and maintains comprehensive intelligence on threats targeting industrial environments worldwide.

DRATA.name: Drata
DRATA.tagline: The trust management platform that automates security and compliance workflows through continuous monitoring and evidence collection
DRATA.overview: Drata is the leading trust management platform that automates security compliance through continuous control monitoring and evidence collection. Founded in 2020 by Adam Markowitz, Daniel Marashlian, and Troy Markowitz, Drata helps thousands of companies streamline compliance with frameworks including SOC 2, ISO 27001, HIPAA, GDPR, PCI DSS, and NIST guidelines. The platform integrates with over 100 cloud services and applications to automatically collect evidence, monitor security controls, and maintain continuous compliance. Backed by prominent tech leaders including Satya Nadella (Microsoft), Jeff Weiner (LinkedIn), and Frank Slootman (Snowflake), Drata achieved unicorn status at a $2B valuation.

DREAM-GAMES.name: Dream Games
DREAM-GAMES.tagline: The Turkish mobile gaming powerhouse behind Royal Match, creating world-class puzzle games loved by over 50 million players worldwide
DREAM-GAMES.overview: Dream Games is an Istanbul-based mobile gaming company founded in 2019 by veterans of Peak Games (acquired by Zynga for $1.8B). The five co-founders—Soner Aydemir, Ikbal Namli, Hakan Saglam, Eren Sengul, and Serdar Yilmaz—created Dream Games to build world-class puzzle games. Their flagship title Royal Match, launched in 2021, became a global phenomenon ranking #3 worldwide for in-app purchases in 2024 with $1.4B in revenue. In 2024, the company generated $2.5B in revenue with $500M EBITDA. In 2025, CVC Capital Partners acquired majority equity at a $5B valuation with Blackstone providing debt financing, making it Turkey's largest tech exit.

DREAM-SECURITY.name: Dream
DREAM-SECURITY.tagline: The first AI-powered cybersecurity company built specifically to defend nations and critical infrastructure at national scale
DREAM-SECURITY.overview: Dream is the first AI-powered cybersecurity company built specifically to defend nations and critical infrastructure. Founded in 2022 by Sebastian Kurz (former Prime Minister of Austria), Shalev Hulio (serial entrepreneur and founder of NSO Group), and Gil Dolev (cyber expert), Dream provides comprehensive cyber resilience solutions for governments and national cybersecurity organizations. In just two years since founding, the company has amassed over $130 million in annual sales and achieved unicorn status at a $1.3B valuation. Dream's AI-native platform enables nation-states to detect, prevent, and respond to sophisticated cyber threats targeting their critical infrastructure.

DREAM11.name: Dream11
DREAM11.tagline: India's biggest fantasy sports platform enabling over 200 million users to create fantasy teams and compete in daily sports contests
DREAM11.overview: Dream11 is India's largest fantasy sports platform where users create virtual teams of real players and compete based on their actual match performance. Founded in 2008 by Harsh Jain and Bhavit Sheth in Mumbai, Dream11 pioneered the fantasy sports category in India and became the country's first fantasy sports unicorn in April 2019. The platform primarily focuses on cricket but has expanded to football, basketball, kabaddi, and other sports. With over 200 million registered users, Dream11 has partnered with major leagues including the Indian Premier League (IPL), International Cricket Council (ICC), and National Basketball Association (NBA). Parent company Dream Sports operates multiple brands including FanCode, DreamSetGo, and Dream Game Studios.

DREMIO.name: Dremio
DREMIO.tagline: The SQL lakehouse platform that delivers lightning-fast queries directly on cloud data lakes without data movement or copies
DREMIO.overview: Dremio is the SQL lakehouse platform that enables enterprises to run sub-second analytics directly on data stored in cloud data lakes like Amazon S3, Azure Data Lake, and Google Cloud Storage. Founded in 2015 in Santa Clara, California, Dremio eliminates the need for data copying and movement by providing a high-performance query engine that sits on top of existing data lake infrastructure. The platform supports Apache Iceberg and other open table formats, enabling organizations to build modern data architectures without vendor lock-in. Dremio is used by leading enterprises to power business intelligence dashboards, data science workflows, and self-service analytics.

DRIVENETS.name: DriveNets
DRIVENETS.tagline: Building the network cloud infrastructure of the future with disaggregated software-based routing for AI and telecommunications
DRIVENETS.overview: DriveNets is a pioneer in cloud-native networking software that enables large-scale network modernization and AI infrastructure. Founded in 2015 in Ra'anana, Israel by Ido Susan and Hillel Kobrinsky, DriveNets developed Network Cloud—a software-based, cloud-native routing system built on a shared infrastructure of standard networking white boxes. The platform disaggregates network hardware from software, dramatically reducing costs while increasing agility. DriveNets Network Cloud is deployed as the core routing solution for AT&T, one of the largest networks in the world, demonstrating the platform's ability to handle massive scale and complexity.

DRIVEWEALTH.name: DriveWealth
DRIVEWEALTH.tagline: The pioneer of fractional share investing empowering global partners to democratize access to US equities through Brokerage-as-a-Service APIs
DRIVEWEALTH.overview: DriveWealth is the pioneer of fractional share investing and the leading Brokerage-as-a-Service platform enabling global fintech companies to offer US equity trading to their customers. Founded in 2012, DriveWealth's patented technology allows partners to embed fractional trading capabilities, from traditional investment workflows to innovative features like round-up investing. The platform powers 100+ partners globally including Block, Revolut, MoneyLion, Papara, and C6 Bank, providing access to US equities, ETFs, mutual funds, fixed income, and options. DriveWealth was named to CNBC's World's Top FinTech Companies 2024 list and has demonstrated over 50% compounded revenue growth over three years.

DROOM.name: Droom
DROOM.tagline: India's first and largest online automobile marketplace connecting buyers with new and used vehicles through a tech-driven platform
DROOM.overview: Droom is India's first and largest technology-driven online automobile marketplace, enabling consumers and dealers to buy and sell new and used cars, motorcycles, scooters, and commercial vehicles. Founded in 2014 by Sandeep Aggarwal (who also founded ShopClues), Droom became a unicorn in 2021 at a $1.2B valuation. The platform hosts 1.1 million automobiles worth $15.7 billion in inventory from over 20,600 dealers across 1,105 cities in India. With 14 million app users, Droom has pioneered services like Orange Book Value (fair market pricing), History (vehicle inspection reports), and ECO (ecosystem for automotive services). Aggarwal is the only Indian entrepreneur to have founded two unicorns back-to-back.

DRUVA.name: Druva
DRUVA.tagline: The leading SaaS platform for cloud data protection delivering backup, disaster recovery, and data governance across endpoints and cloud workloads
DRUVA.overview: Druva is the leading SaaS platform for cloud data protection, enabling organizations to backup, recover, and govern their data across endpoints, cloud applications, and data center workloads. Founded in 2008 by Jaspreet Singh, Milind Borate, and Ramani Kothandaraman, Druva has grown to serve over 6,000 customers worldwide with $304M in annual revenue. As a 100% SaaS solution, Druva eliminates the need for hardware infrastructure while delivering industry-leading RPO and RTO guarantees. DUBIZZLE-GROUP.name: Dubizzle Group
DUBIZZLE-GROUP.tagline: Leading MENA and South Asia online classifieds platform powering digital commerce in emerging markets through Bayut, Zameen, and OLX brands
DUBIZZLE-GROUP.overview: Dubizzle Group (formerly EMPG - Emerging Markets Property Group) is the leading online classifieds and property portal platform across the Middle East, North Africa, and South Asia. The company operates multiple market-leading brands including Dubizzle, Bayut, Zameen.com, OLX Pakistan, OLX Egypt, OLX Lebanon, and Lamudi. Founded by brothers Imran and Zeeshan Ali Khan, the group achieved unicorn status in 2020 and has since grown to over 2,400 employees across multiple markets. With platforms serving millions of users across property, automotive, and general classifieds, Dubizzle Group is positioning for a Dubai IPO in 2025 with Goldman Sachs, Emirates NBD, HSBC, and Morgan Stanley as mandated banks.

DUEROS.name: DuerOS (Baidu Smart Living Group)
DUEROS.tagline: China's leading conversational AI platform powering voice assistants across smart speakers, automotive, and IoT devices with Xiaodu ecosystem
DUEROS.overview: DuerOS is Baidu's conversational AI platform and the technology behind Baidu Smart Living Group (SLG), China's second-largest smart speaker ecosystem. Operating as a near-independent subsidiary valued at $2.9 billion after Series A funding in 2020, DuerOS powers over 400 million smart devices including the popular Xiaodu smart speaker line. The platform features full-duplex conversation mode, 200+ skill domains, and partnerships with major automotive brands including BMW, Daimler, Ford, Hyundai, and Kia. DuerOS competes directly with Alibaba's Tmall Genie and Xiaomi's XiaoAI, serving as China's answer to Amazon Alexa and Google Assistant.

DUNAMU.name: Dunamu
DUNAMU.tagline: South Korea's largest cryptocurrency and fintech company operating Upbit exchange with over 80% domestic market share
DUNAMU.overview: Dunamu is South Korea's largest cryptocurrency company and the operator of Upbit, the country's dominant digital asset exchange commanding over 80% market share. The platform ranks as the world's fourth-largest cryptocurrency exchange by trading volume, processing over $2 billion in daily transactions. In 2024, Dunamu reported record financial results with operating profit of ₩1.19 trillion ($811M) and sales revenue of ₩1.73 trillion, demonstrating the strength of the Korean crypto market. The company also operates Stockplus investment platforms and Onboard equity management. In November 2025, internet giant Naver agreed to acquire Dunamu for $10.3 billion, reshaping Korea's fintech landscape.

DUNE-ANALYTICS.name: Dune Analytics
DUNE-ANALYTICS.tagline: Leading blockchain data analytics platform enabling community-driven insights with 700K+ dashboards tracking crypto and DeFi ecosystems
DUNE-ANALYTICS.overview: Dune Analytics is the leading community-powered blockchain data analytics platform, enabling users to query, visualize, and share insights from on-chain data across Ethereum, Bitcoin, Solana, and 20+ other blockchains. Founded in 2018 in Oslo, Norway by Fredrik Haga and Mats Olsen, Dune became a unicorn in 2022 after raising $69.2 million at a $1 billion valuation. The platform hosts over 700,000 community-created dashboards tracking DeFi protocols, NFT markets, and blockchain activity. In 2024, Dune expanded through a Snowflake partnership to distribute blockchain data to enterprise customers, and acquired smlXL to enhance its data infrastructure capabilities.

DUTCHIE.name: Dutchie
DUTCHIE.tagline: All-in-one cannabis technology platform powering 6,500+ dispensaries with POS, e-commerce, payments, and marketing solutions
DUTCHIE.overview: Dutchie is the leading cannabis technology platform in North America, powering over 6,500 dispensaries and processing more than $22 billion in annual cannabis sales. The company provides an all-in-one solution including point of sale systems, e-commerce, payments processing, and loyalty marketing tools for cannabis retailers. Founded in 2017, Dutchie reached a peak valuation of $3.8 billion in 2021 backed by prominent investors including Tiger Global, Thrive Capital, and celebrity backers Snoop Dogg (Casa Verde Capital), Kevin Durant, and former Starbucks CEO Howard Schultz. The company has consolidated the cannabis tech market through strategic acquisitions including Greenbits and Leaf Logix.

DXY.name: DXY (Dingxiang Yuan)
DXY.tagline: China's largest online healthcare community connecting physicians, patients, and healthcare organizations through digital platforms
DXY.overview: DXY (Dingxiang Yuan, 丁香园) is China's largest online healthcare community and digital service provider, connecting physicians, consumers, and healthcare organizations since 2000. The platform has built the country's most comprehensive physician network with online forums, mobile applications, and wholly-owned clinics providing telemedicine services. DXY serves as a bridge between pharmaceutical companies like Pfizer and the Chinese medical community, offering professional education, clinical resources, and patient engagement tools. Backed by Tencent with a $500 million investment, DXY achieved unicorn status and continues to lead China's digital health transformation.

DYDX.name: dYdX
DYDX.tagline: Leading decentralized exchange for perpetual trading built on its own Layer 1 blockchain with advanced order book matching
DYDX.overview: dYdX is a leading decentralized cryptocurrency exchange specializing in perpetual trading, built by founder Antonio Juliano (ex-Coinbase, ex-Uber). Originally launched on Ethereum, dYdX migrated to its own Layer 1 blockchain (dYdX Chain) powered by Cosmos SDK to achieve higher throughput and full decentralization. The platform offers advanced trading features including 20x leverage on perpetual contracts, professional-grade order books, and sub-second trade execution. Backed by top-tier crypto investors including Paradigm, a16z, and Polychain Capital, dYdX has processed billions in trading volume and pioneered the decentralized derivatives market with its DYDX governance token.
